Articles.Content:
I decided that I need some help with setting up maneuver nodes for interplanetary transfer. So I am trying to install Mechjeb 2.

Mechjeb version 2.11.0.0; KSP version 1.10.1

I pasted it into KSP/GameData directory.

It doesn't seem to start. No new parts, no new menus, no new buttons.  Is it supposed to add a new button to toolbar, the way AlarmClock and Kerbal Engineer does?

I feel stupid. Am I supposed to activate it somehow?

Edited September 5, 2020 by Lechu

It looks like your problem may be more of a "how do I install mods" than a "how do I install MechJeb."

So in that vein I'm going to suggest you look into Ckan. It turns mod install and maintenance into a simple job of finding the mod in a list and clicking an install button.

 

Edited September 5, 2020 by Superfluous J
Added link to page
If it is installed correctly, then start up a new sandbox game to check if the interfaces are there.   You need to unlock the various modules in a career game, so it might not show up right away.

I have installed it just the same way as AlarmClock and Kerbal Engineer - these two both do work.

Unzipped it into gamedata folder. Is it even possible to do it wrong?

1 hour ago, Lechu said:

I have installed it just the same way as AlarmClock and Kerbal Engineer - these two both do work.

Unzipped it into gamedata folder. Is it even possible to do it wrong?

Do you have the latest Module Manager?

Did you maybe put the zipped folder inside the gamedata folder?

Check what Gargamel said, if you are on Career you need to unlock it.

If not there should be a Mechjeb button/toolbar top right i think.

You dont need to put a part like the old days as long there is a command pod.

But you can still use them if you want to.

Maybe you have a conflicting mod?I doubt it though.

Edited September 5, 2020 by Boyster

It is unzipped in the gamedata  folder. In new game, sandbox mode, it also does not work.

Do I necessarily need Module Manager?

16 minutes ago, Lechu said:

It is unzipped in the gamedata  folder. In new game, sandbox mode, it also does not work.

Do I necessarily need Module Manager?

Yes you need module manager or else it wont work.

On 9/5/2020 at 2:27 PM, Serenity said:

Yes you need module manager or else it wont work.

I got that, Using KSP version 0.23.
